statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: minutes
statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.name: rebounds
statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).

statistics.name: defensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the defense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot by the offense.

statistics.name: offensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the offense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot.

article.description: Quadir Welton scored 18 points and Trevis Wyche added 17 more to lead Saint Peter's to an 84-70 win over Manhattan on Sunday.
article.headline: Saint Peter's cruises to 84-70 win over Manhattan
article.linkText: Saint Peter's cruises to 84-70 win over Manhattan
article.story: JERSEY CITY, N.J. -- Quadir Welton scored 18 points and Trevis Wyche added 17 more to lead Saint Peter's to an 84-70 win over Manhattan on Sunday. Antwon Portley had 15 points on 6-of-7 shooting, including a pair of 3-pointers, and Samuel Idowu got 10 points for Saint Peter's (4-3, 1-1 Metro Atlantic). Welton and Wyche hit a combined 19 of 29 from the line. The Peacocks shot 54 percent from the field and took control with an 18-4 run stretching across both sides of the intermission to make it 54-30 with 14:05 left. Portley had a 3-pointer and two jumpers in the breakaway run. Manhattan (2-6, 0-2) edged into an early 5-4 lead with Calvin Crawford's 3-pointer less than five minutes into the game, but fell behind for good on Saint Peter's next possession. Zavier Turner led the Jaspers with 30 points, while Aaron Walker Jr. and Thomas Capuano had 10 points apiece.
